metadata.synopsis: Avatar and Orphan Origin Moment for Karlach meeting the paladins of Tyr that leads into combat.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Play as Avatar Karlach or move the rest of the party away if she is a companion and speak with Anders (WLD_Main_A: 111; 38; 561)

29.speaker: Anders
29.text: That's right, Karlach. So now as in the Hells. I can see why Her Ladyship wants a murderous brute like you back.
29.context: NodeContext: stronger in tone, with an edge in his voice; the mask is slipping

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: 'Her Ladyship'. Zariel really has you under her thumb, doesn't she? Pathetic.

7.speaker: Anders
7.text: Rage all you want, Karlach. Burn with the might of the Hells. Zariel will find you, and she will bring you back in pieces.

40.speaker: Anders
40.text: Then again, maybe she'll just leave you here. Far from home, with an infernal engine for a heart, slowly burning you to ash from the inside.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: Avernus was never my home. It was my prison. I'm free now. AND I'M NEVER GOING BACK.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Burning at max; combat starts.NodeContext: Barbarian rage

43.speaker: Anders
43.text: Paladins, to arms! The devil has found us.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: Whoa now. I think you're confusing me with someone else.

57.speaker: Anders
57.text: Our lord Tyr told us of your guise: The one-horned tiefling hiding the devil within. Servant of Zariel, soldier of the Blood War.

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: Tyr - god of justice, isn't that right? If you really serve him, you'll know I never served Zariel willingly.

60.speaker: Anders
60.text: The god of Justice never speaks false.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *The god of Justice may not be a liar, but this so-called 'paladin' most certainly is.*

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: Enough of the theatrics. Who are you really?

66.speaker: Anders
66.text: You always were sharper than Her Ladyship gave you credit for.

61.speaker: Anders
61.text: 'My Karlach is a cudgel,' she'd say. 'No finesse to speak of, but useful for cracking skulls.'

51.speaker: Anders
51.text: She made you what you are, Karlach. She wants you to come home. Alive, if possible. Dead, if not.

38.speaker: Karlach
38.text: You should've skipped the 'paladins of Tyr' gimmick and faced me for what you are.

30.speaker: Anders
30.text: Better not to scare off a wild animal until you're ready to spring your trap.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: Avernus was never my home. It was my prison. I'm never going back.

16.speaker: Anders
16.context: NodeContext: Right before combat, so vamping up in evilness.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: Fine. I'll go quietly. Me and Zariel can settle this face-to-face.

63.speaker: Anders
63.text: Did you hear that, fellows? Karlach wants us to let down our guard, shackle her, then burn us to cinders en route back to Avernus.

6.speaker: Anders
6.text: Knock her out. And if she dies in the attempt, all the better.

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: I'd rather die than look at her fucking face ever again.

27.speaker: Anders
27.text: I serve Tyr, from now until my dying day. And he has ruled for your execution, devil.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: Tell me who you really are, and maybe we can find another way to settle this.

23.speaker: Anders
23.text: Diplomacy! Interesting. But I suppose you were always more complex than Her Ladyship gave you credit for.

17.speaker: Anders
17.text: Paladins, ho! Tonight we decorate our hall with this devil's last horn.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Everything I did in Avernus was against my will. I never wanted to serve Zariel - not for a second.

42.speaker: Karlach
42.text: 'Slave' more than 'soldier'. Whatever I've done was against my will.

0.speaker: Anders
0.text: 'If your right hand commits injustice, remove it with your left.' If you were truly just, you would not have let yourself be used in such a fashion.

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *That is no maxim of Tyr - nor a Tyrran belief. The Just God does not hold underlings responsible for the commands of tyrants.*

39.speaker: Karlach
39.text: I didn't let Zariel do anything. I had no choice.

52.speaker: Anders
52.text: Save your excuses for the City of Judgement. Perhaps Tyr will take pity on you there, for he is the head of justice. We are merely its sword.

65.speaker: Karlach
65.text: You've got to reconsider. I don't want to hurt you.

56.speaker: Anders
56.text: Then your last words will be a lie, will they? I'd expect no different from the likes of you.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: What do you want, then? A fight? Cause I'll give you one.

10.speaker: Karlach
10.text: I don't have time for this. I didn't come here for a fight, but if you want one, I'm game.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: I'm no devil. What's this all about?

54.speaker: Anders
54.text: You lie so easily. But I suppose it is easy for your kind. Tyr warned us not to believe a word out of your mouth, servant of Zariel.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: I'm going to start behaving like a devil if you keep calling me one.

47.speaker: Anders
47.text: I know what you are. And your threats mean nothing. A servant of Zariel has no power here. The Just God Tyr has claimed these roads.
